item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18923)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @homelessoutloud was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=homelessoutloud&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

item.title: City attorneys and DHOL agree on this one!
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

City attorneys and DHOL agree on this one!

item.title: "The City of Denver should allow organizations to set up...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"The City of Denver should allow organizations to set up safe-camping sites for people experiencing homelessness, where they would be safer from COVID and also have centralized access to sanitation and services."
---
But then you would have visible poverty and the Mayor hates to admit there are poor people living in Denver. Its bad for is "image".

https://www.westword.com/…/homeless-denver-safe-camping-sit…

Skeptical at first, the city has fully bought into safe-camping sites.

westword.com

After Eighteen Months, Safe-Camping Sites Find a Home in Denver

Skeptical at first, the city has fully bought into safe-camping sites.Skeptical at first, the city has fully bought into safe-camping sites.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: "But Hinds said his idea to put a camp on the front lawn of...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"But Hinds said his idea to put a camp on the front lawn of City Hall “did not make the news,”
---
I wonder why the news would not pick up on something like that or perhaps they ignored it on purpose.

https://original.newsbreak.com/…/2405410253912-councilman-p…

The view from the doorstep of Denver City Hall.Library of Congress. Denver City Councilman Chris Hinds has proposed erecting a legal homeless camping site outside City Hall. The encampment, known as a safe outdoor space, would be placed between 14th and Colfax on the pedestrian mall. “It would mea...

original.newsbreak.com

Councilman proposes homeless camp outside Denver City Hall | David Heitz | NewsBreak Original

The view from the doorstep of Denver City Hall.Library of Congress. Denver City Councilman Chris Hinds has proposed erecting a legal homeless camping site outside City Hall. The encampment, known as a safe outdoor space, would be placed between 14th and Colfax on the pedestrian mall. “It would mea...The view from the doorstep of Denver City Hall.Library of Congress. Denver City Councilman Chris Hinds has proposed erecting a legal homeless camping site outside City Hall. The encampment, known as a safe outdoor space, would be placed between 14th and Colfax on the pedestrian mall. “It would mea...
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The city of Denver has filed a lawsuit against ballot initiative...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The city of Denver has filed a lawsuit against ballot initiative 303.

It is full of legalese but basically Denver is claiming it overreaches
what can be on a ballot in the first place and something about part
of it may not be illegal implying that the rest of it is illegal.

...

Remember the city used a similar tactic against our ballot initiative The Right to Survive Act. They claimed outreach workers doing their normal job approaching an encampment would be considered "harassment". They didn't file a lawsuit but that was a narrative that folks picked up quickly. Would-be supporters began to say ""good intentions" but poorly written."
It caved a bill that had a 2-1 advantage in initial polling.


https://www.scribd.com/…/City-of-Denver-Complaint-Against-I…

See MoreOn October 15, 2021, the City of Denver filed a lawsuit in the Denver District Court asking a judge to partially block Initiative 303, which Denver voters will weigh in on in the November 2 election.

scribd.com

City of Denver Complaint Against Initiative 303

On October 15, 2021, the City of Denver filed a lawsuit in the Denver District Court asking a judge to partially block Initiative 303, which Denver voters will weigh in on in the November 2 election.On October 15, 2021, the City of Denver filed a lawsuit in the Denver District Court asking a judge to partially block Initiative 303, which Denver voters will weigh in on in the November 2 election.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS week of 10/18-10/22/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 10/18-10/22/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 10/19 at E. 17th Avenue to the North, N. Marion Street to the East, E. Colfax Avenue to the South, and N. Ogden Street to the West; Wednesday 10/20 at Speer Blvd, Lincoln St, East 5th Ave, and Bannock St; and on Thursday 10/21 at West 6th Ave, Santa Fe Drive, West Alameda Ave. and Interstate 25.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to exist.
Your advocacy and community support is much appreciated!
Speaking truth to power, housing is a human right!

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS update 10/11-10/15/21 SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update 10/11-10/15/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 10/12 at W. Louisiana and S. Lipan there were only 2 residents left at 5am. The area was cleared by 6:30am. Only trash was left to pick up. Approximately 10 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPS resumed on Wednesday 10/13 at Raritan Way and Quivas St. There were two camps. 17 tents and 5 rvs. Councilman Kashman was present once again, arriving while it was still dark. Approximately 40 people were traumatical...ly displaced.
SWEEPS concluded on Thursday 10/14 at 10th and Corona. Citizens for a Safe and Clean Denver showed up and put their signage on the fence. DHOL was asked by the MDHI social worker to ask representatives of Safe and Clean Denver to not take video of the resident they were attempting to assist while in crisis. Denver fire also requested assistance in asking Safe and Clean Denver to leave. Good thing Safe and Clean Denver was there to protect city workers from DHOL! They eventually left to hand out flyers at the King Soopers nearby. Employees from Volunteers of America came to help a veteran resident veteran housing. Approximately 15 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution.
Speaking truth to power, housing is a human right!

item.title: SWEEPS update 10/11-10/15/21 SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update 10/11-10/15/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 10/12 at W. Louisiana and S. Lipan there were only 2 residents left at 5am. The area was cleared by 6:30am. Only trash was left to pick up. Approximately 10 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPS resumed on Wednesday 10/13 at Raritan Way and Quivas St. There were two camps. 17 tents and 5 rvs. Councilman Kashman was present once again, arriving while it was still dark. Approximately 40 people were traumatical...ly displaced.
SWEEPS concluded on Thursday 10/14 at 10th and Corona. Citizens for a Safe and Clean Denver showed up and put their signage on the fence. DHOL was asked by the MDHI social worker to ask representatives of Safe and Clean Denver to not take video of the resident they were attempting to assist while in crisis. Denver fire also requested assistance in asking Safe and Clean Denver to leave. Good thing Safe and Clean Denver was there to protect city workers from DHOL! They eventually left to hand out flyers at the King Soopers nearby. Employees from Volunteers of America came to help a veteran resident veteran housing. Approximately 15 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution.
Speaking truth to power, housing is a human right!

item.title: We at Denver Homeless Out Loud recently went through a...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We at Denver Homeless Out Loud recently went through a transformative justice process which culminated in the resignation of Terese Howard. We assure you that the important work that DHOL has been doing will continue. If Terese was your contact with our organization, please use info@denverhomelessoutloud.org or call 720-940-5291 to get back to work.
Speaking truth to power, housing is a human right!

Denver Homeless Out Loud
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: When we’re not working for our community we’re volunteering...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

When we’re not working for our community we’re volunteering for our community. We love our youth!!

item.title: We have recorded many close calls. Will Denver be the first to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We have recorded many close calls. Will Denver be the first to throw a human being away? Maybe we already have. This has to stop.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J8GwjYGAzgk

The District put a halt to a plan to remove a homeless encampment from a NoMa neighborhood after a bulldozer struck a tent with a man in it. MORE: https://bi...

youtube.com

VIDEO: Bulldozer strikes tent with a man in it during DC homeless encampment removal | FOX 5 DC

The District put a halt to a plan to remove a homeless encampment from a NoMa neighborhood after a bulldozer struck a tent with a man in it. item.title: UPDATE: Sweep on Tuesday is at W Louisiana and S Lipan SWEEPS...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

UPDATE: Sweep on Tuesday is at W Louisiana and S Lipan
SWEEPS next week are on Wednesday 10/13 at 6th Avenue, Osage Street, W. 3rd Avenue, and Interstate 25; and on Thursday 10/14 at E. 11th Avenue, N. Downing Street, E. 9th Avenue, and Emerson Street.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291
dhol logo.png

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud
